Reviews.Title: Excellent cable for the price
Reviews.Author: Bejay in Spring
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased this HDMI cable for my Roku XDS I shopped around first at nearby Walmart and Best Buy, and read some reviews for this product.  I'm a retired electrical engineer and do not believe on going overboard, spending more than adequate to get a good result on  audio and video component.  There are cables in the market that are priced too high to get the money out of those people who are willing to pay the price.  Those people always believed that if the price is high, the product must be very good.  For digital signal transmission, this HDMI cable is more than adequate.  My video and audio were not degraded, and I did not notice any lost of clarity either on video or audio signal.

Reviews.Title: A bit difficult to maneuver
Reviews.Author: Sadie
Reviews.Content: I hooked this braided HDMI cable between my HDTV and my computer to stream video from the internet to my HDTV.  The picture is clear and the sound quality is very good.  I don't see any difference while using this cable from computer to HDTV than I do when watching TV directly from my satellite box.  The only problem I have with this cable is that it is very thick due to the braiding, which makes it hard to turn.  I need to plug it into one side of my HDTV, loop it around the back of the TV and bring it out on the other side where I place my computer out of tripping range.  The thickness of the cable makes it hard to loop around and it's heavier than the other cables I have.  This cable would probably be best for professional use where there might be heavy usage and plugging and unplugging of the cord.  It will probably stand the test of time and constant movement easier than the regular smooth vinyl cables.  But, for normal home use, the vinyl cables are easier to handle.For anyone who has not used an HDMI cable and is new to HDTV, this cable can be used to hook up your cable box, DVD or Blu Ray disc player, computer, Wii, sound system and whatever else you have that has an HDMI cable connector.  You do not need to use separate audio cables as this beauty steams everything through it.  It's super simple to use - just plug it in to your HDTV and plug the other end into the other component and play.  I suggest getting HDMI cables for each separate component so you don't have to pull out the DVD cable to plug in your computer.

Reviews.Title: HDMI 1.4/1.3x cable, get full support from Amazon
Reviews.Author: A. Dent "Aragorn"
Reviews.Content: WHO NEEDS IT?This wire should work well with anything that supports HDMI 1.3x but it's built to comply with the higher HDMI 1.4 standard. You may consider this product if you have TWO devices that support HDMI 1.4. For these, the cable will carry through HD images and Ethernet data therefore eliminating the need for one dedicated Ethernet cable and one Ethernet port. Again, on a pair of connected HDMI 1.4 devices, it will eliminate the need of a dedicated audio cable if, let's say, your TV needs to send sound back to your receiver - it may have a built-in Blu/DVD player or get its input through an USB port. You may also consider this cable if you currently need an extra HDMI 1.3 cable but you are planning to to replace your existing equipment with some HDMI 1.4 ready hardware in the near future.As far as HDMI 1.4 stands, this cable is 'it'. It's the complete implementation because it supports ALL HDMI 1.4 features.HOW GOOD IS IT?- Behaves as a HDMI 1.3x 'high speed' or 'category 2' cable.- As a 'high speed' HDMI 1.4 cable, it supports video resolutions of at least 1080p and can go as high as 4K.- The 'data channel' (Ethernet support) works only with HDMI 1.4 ready equipment.- The 'audio return channel' is another feature supported by HDMI 1.4 ready equipment only. It will allow for audio to be sent 'back' from, let's say a TV to the HDMI 1.4 compliant receiver, therefore eliminating the need for a dedicated audio cable.- It should support all the HDMI 1.4 extra color palettes because those are implemented by the HDMI 1.4 compliant connected equipment.You may want to get this cable even if your equipment is not HDMI 1.4, it doesn't hurt to get a wire that supports a higher standard and, with free shipping the price difference is not that great. And, keep in mind that Amazon stands behind this product so returns should be easy.END OF REVIEW______________________________________________________What follows is the byproduct of me attempting to clarify 'HDMI 1.4' for myself and understanding this specific product's features. I thought I'd share.WHAT'S IN A NAME? (understanding this cable's features)- HDMI 1.4 is a new HDMI standard adopted in 2009, backward compatible with HDMI 1.3. This cable should work with your existing equipment.- HIGH SPEED indicates that this cable supports resolutions of 1080p or higher and 3D video (unlike the HDMI 1.4 STANDARD cables which, believe it or not, are limited to 720p/1080i - why? nobody knows).- ETHERNET means that this cable supports a full-duplex 100 Mb/sec Ethernet connection - if you have 2 HDMI 1.4 ready devices and they both need an network connection, this cable will carry through the Ethernet datastream to the second device, therefore saving you the need for one extra Ethernet cable.- Audio Return Channel is a feature that would save you the need of a dedicated audio cable between 2 HDMI 1.4 compliant devices.- This cable should support the full set of 3D features found in the new TVs.THE HDMI 1.4x DIFFERENCEHDMI 1.4 allows for the following new features:- Ethernet Channel - allows for the 2 connected devices to communicate with each other and share one network connection.- Audio Return Channel - eliminates the need of a second cable if you want to send audio from your TV back to your receiver.- 3D - It's supported by HDMI 1.3x but HDMI 1.4a specifically supports all the currently agreed-upon industry standards- 4K resolution - good to have it but there is nothing on today's market that would take advantage of this- Expanded support for new color spaces - by supporting sYCC601, AdobeRGB, and AdobeYCC601 it better aligns your display with the color spaces supported by digital cameras.- Type D connector - the 'Micro' connector is to be used by small, portable devices with supported resolutions of up to 1080p.The HDMI Consortium defines 4 broad types of HDMI 1.4 cables:* Standard HDMI Cable* High Speed HDMI Cable* Standard HDMI Cable with Ethernet* High Speed HDMI Cable with EthernetOf the above, only the 'High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet' (this one) makes sense and it's likely to emerge as the common HDMI 1.4 cable.Standard cables are limited to lower-resolution displays up to (approx. 720p or 1080i). High Speed cables support higher-resolution display (e.g. 1080p). They can deliver all video content currently defined for the HDMI standard (i.e. more than two 1080p/60 video streams, including 3D). HDMI cables with Ethernet are capable of sending 100/mbps over the HDMI Ethernet Channel. Since it is not likely that many HDMI 1.4 'standard' cables will be made or sold, I suspect that the crippled 'standard' type exists only to allow for calling the cables that support 1080p 'high speed' which sounds good and high-end.-->> Brush your teeth, it's the law! <<

Reviews.Title: A Basic Cable at a Good Price
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Descy
Reviews.Content: This is the HDMI cable to get right now: an HDMI 1.4 cable at a good price.HDMI 1.4HDMI 1.4 is the latest standard (as of November 2010 at least). It is backward compatible with other HDMI gear (mine all are HDMI 1.3 compliant). And it will be more useful to you if your TV supports HDMI 1.4 networking. I was not able to test the Ethernet networking capability of this cable, but I think the idea behind it is a good one.For my current home entertainment setup, I had to set up separate Internet connections on my TV, set top box, Blu-Ray player, and WD TV LIVE (HTPC). It would have been a lot easier if I could have just set up my TV's internet connection, and allow all of my components to share it. That's what HDMI 1.4 promises to let you do--as long as all of your hardware, including the cables, supports it. This cable will support that functionality; it's more "future-proof" than the HDMI 1.3 cables I have been using.Learn more (and see nice diagrams) at [...]This CableThis cable is really long, so I don't recommend it if your components are very close together. A 3-foot cable would easily suffice in that case.Overall ImpressionsThis cable is a great buy. Definitely order it if your new A/V or PC components don't come with an HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: Performs as well as more expensive cables.
Reviews.Author: Jish M.
Reviews.Content: I tested this versus a Monster brand cable and was unable to discern any difference in audio or video performance.  I connected this cable from my TV directly to two devices to test it out: Apple TV and Roku XD.  It worked perfectly with both of them.The cable is rather thick due to its shielding and braiding.  Be sure that the holes in your home theater furniture have enough room to pass these cables through (my holes are already so jammed with cables I had a hard time!). Having said that, the thickness give the cable a real "quality feel" ... not that it matters since this is something you "set and forget" and really should be out of sight anyhow.I was unable to test the ethernet sharing capabilities of this cable.A HUGE bonus was the frustration-free packaging.  THANK YOU AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: Quality Product at a Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: FirePepper Red "firepepper red"
Reviews.Content: I have tried a number of different HDMI cables ranging from very cheap to extremely expensive.  I have not found any difference in signal quality between the high priced name brands and the cheaper versions.  Some of the cheaper cables did have issues with meeting the latest HDMI standards and that is where these Amazon cables fit in.  These cables provide the latest HDMI standards along with the same performance as name brand cables. I have not tested the Ethernet capability but I know that it is there for future products that may need it.  Why would you pay more when these cables provide the same functionality at a fraction of the cost?*** Positive Points: ***- Great Build Quality (unlike some cheaper cables that have cheap connectors)- Work EXACTLY the same as higher priced cables*** Negative Points: ***- Absolutely noneOverall:  Very few products deserve 5 stars but these cables provide excellent performance, high quality all at a reasonable cost.  Nothing less than 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Great Value! Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Julie Jo
Reviews.Content: I bought a brand new 65" TV and already had a set of HDMI cables and they worked with my other TV so, I didn't think anything of it. My new TV came, I set it up and used my regular set of HDMI cables but, I wasn't getting a picture so, I was baffled. Ironically Several days earlier I had ordered a set of AmazonBasics High Definition cables just figuring that it might enhance my picture but, not realizing that I needed a High Definition HDMI cable in order for my new TV to transmit the picture.Well, needless to say I remembered I had ordered the High Def. cables and decided to give it a try and Voila! A big beautiful picture came up on my brand new TV.I couldn't believe the price and quality of the product and from now on I'm an "AmazonBasics" fan.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfect, and has a bit of future proofing
Reviews.Author: J. Dugas "signature"
Reviews.Content: I plugged this in to connect my PS3 and my television. It worked perfect and immediately; there were no issues. I don't have a tv that supports the Ethernet feature, but I figured this was a good cable to get since I will already have the cable when I get a tv that supports Ethernet HDMI.

Reviews.Title: Simple, basic, hassle free and a price you CANNOT beat.
Reviews.Author: Cliff Saunders
Reviews.Content: Go out to Best Buy or any large box store. You're not getting out of there with a 3 foot cable for under $30 bucks. Insanity! This is really the only sane choice. Order two and keep one around until you get the next awesome HDMI gadget. I have one hooked up to an XBOX and it looks crystal clear, as well as a DVD player. So nice! I wish I had more HDMI gear to use with these cables.

Reviews.Title: Superb quality, unbeatable price
Reviews.Author: FreeSpirit
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent deal on a superb quality high speed HDMI 1.3x cable that also complies with the HDMI 1.4 standard. It supports video at 1080 resolution with the capability to go even higher, and sound quality seems just as good as it is with a digital optical cable.The 2M length of the cord seems just right for most devices that we have them connected to. Enough to comfortably connect without having too much extra cable hanging from the devices. The cable is thinner than some of the thick Monster cables I have used before, which makes it more flexible and easier to maneuver around devices.There really is no point paying a higher amount for Monster HDMI cables that sell for ridiculous amounts at retails stores. I remember those were at $100+ a few years ago, haven't checked their prices lately. Well, don't need to check price because the price on the Amazon Basics cables beats them hands down any day. The cable quality seems to be sturdy. The plugs fit into the TV/devices well, and the picture and sound quality is great. Not much to think about, this one's a no brainer!

Reviews.Title: It works.
Reviews.Author: Doffod "Bookworm"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased quite a few AmazonBasics items including iphone case, camera bag and etc., they all seem to be quality items with very affordable price tags.  This cable is no exception, the name says it all, it's one of the things you have to have for your home entertainment needs. It does what it's supposed to and the price is very reasonable. I didn't pay for this one though, it came from the Vine program.

Reviews.Title: Better than MonsterCable...
Reviews.Author: Brent D. Payne "SEO Director, Tribune"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a lot of HDMI cables over the past couple of years. Typically, I spend about $100 on them. I find it, frankly, ridiculous that the industry is able to take advantage of consumers to this level, but I do it. Why? Because I feel if I spend thousands on a receiver, an HDTV, etc. that I don't want my cabling to be the bottleneck of the system.I had a chance to get my hands on the Amazon Basics High Speed HDMI cable and I thought I'd give it a go. I am glad I did.1. The cable is of SUPERB quality. I feels in your hand even better than MonsterCable, Audioquest, etc.2. The cable is the perfect length. Usually the cable are either 1-meter or 3-meters. Either too short or too long. The 2 meter length is just perfect.3. It has the technology to work perfectly with 3D, 240MHz, etc. That's important considering you'll want to make sure you are buying cabling that is 'future proof'.4. The price is much better than you'd get for similar or lesser quality from Monster or Audioquest.5. It's Amazon backed . . . okay, so everything is Amazon-backed but I just get some added comfort knowing this is Amazon's white-labeled brand. But I'm an Amazon fanboy so . . . :-)I will definitely buy my future cable needs from AmazonBasics . . . because their cabling is far from 'basic'.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable Value!
Reviews.Author: Nathan A. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I have been putting off the purchase of an HDMI Cable for way too long; primarily due to the ridiculous prices asked of them at the major retailers. However, I just received my Amazon Basics HDMI cable and have finally been able to ditch the old-school RCA connection and properly set up our PS3 with what is definitely a quality product at a value price. I feel so foolish that we have been playing games and watching Blu-ray on state-of-the-art equipment all connected with technology from before my birth. HDMI really does make that much of a difference and Amazon has made the price point reasonable enough to justify the purchase. Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Signal quality was horrible
Reviews.Author: Patti
Reviews.Content: I bought this cable with a new Blu-Ray player.  Whenever I watched anything, I'd see a white flash on the screen every 30-60 seconds.  Sometimes the audio dropped out, but mostly I just got random flashes of white on the screen no matter what I was watching.I swapped the cable with a different brand, and playback is rock solid.  To check for loose connections, I swapped this cable back in, and the white flashes returned.It surprises me that Amazon would put their name on a product of such low quality.

Reviews.Title: Mine is a dud, which may indicate poor quality, poor consistency in production, or poor quality control
Reviews.Author: JAMES A JONES
Reviews.Content: It didn't work consistently for me. I kept getting connection issues, where the signal was being received on and off between my components. I have multiple HDMI components, and cycled around my existing cables with this one. Every time, the source component to which this cable was connected was unable to provide a consistent connection, cutting in and out. When I switched the cable out with another HDMI cable, the problem went away. Tried this cable on another source component, and immediately, the problem started up there where I never had the problem before. I've isolated all problems down to this cable.Given the reviews here, I'm sure that I just got a dud. But, I figured I'd report it so that others can gauge the error rate on these. For me, I'm now going to be reluctant to purchase another AmazonBasics again.

Reviews.Title: Works great on 2 tv's
Reviews.Author: prime311
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these one for each of my HDTV's and they work great.  Its used to connect a PS3 and an HD Uverse receiver.  Cable is very solid and at a great price for the latest and greatest HDMI cable.  Would highly recommend for anyone purchasing new cables or wanting to upgrade their existing cables to 1.4 standard.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable cables
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Have purchased five Amazon Basics High Speed HDMI cables. Two 2-meter cables connecting sources to receiver are still working after less than one month of use. But two out of three 3-meter cables connecting TV to receiver have failed... just suddenly ceased to transmit a signal during use. The first crashed within a month of operation, the second after 15 months. Both connections resumed without problem when cables were replaced with a name brand. I am replacing all of the remaining Amazon cables now, as I cannot trust that they will continue to function.

Reviews.Title: Good while it lasted...
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these 6 months ago.  Lowe and behold one of them failed last month and now this month the other one has failed.  I've bought cheaper cables from monoprice and they still work fine.  Maybe I got a bad batch or something, but really there is no excuse for both of the cables that I bought to have failed within six months.  I would not buy again.

Reviews.Title: I got a dud
Reviews.Author: Jen C
Reviews.Content: I bought this cable based on all the positive reviews I saw, thinking it would work well. Well, it didn't work at all. I tried everything with my new tv thinking it was my cable box or the tv or just connected wrong. Finally I bought a new cable and everything worked exactly as it should. I'd return it but the postage, time and packaging are worth more than what I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: A possible hit or miss ...
Reviews.Author: Digital Daniel
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these HDMI cables one to keep and the other as a gift to a friend.The first cable I used did not work connecting my PS3 to a LCD monitor, so I tried the second cable one and it worked!Then I tried the non-working cable on another PS3 to a TV and as expected it didn't work, hence I returned it!So from my experience it is hit and miss.Construction is decent, the price is right and I'm sure for most people that get the working cables it is excellent.For me not so good!

Reviews.Title: Best value of name-brand HDMI cables
Reviews.Author: S. Smerud
Reviews.Content: There are other inexpensive HDMI cables that may do just fine, but if you want to pay a few extra dollars for a brand and customer service you can trust, there is no better value than this cable.  It is shielded and has the latest HDMI standard to support everything you need today, including 3D and Ethernet.  The cable itself is also a little more flexible and the head is a little smaller than all my previous HDMI cables (Monster, Accell, & Belkin), allowing it to fit in some tight areas where other cables may not.  If there's a difference in the image quality with any other brand names, I can't see it.  It was well-packaged with plastic caps to protect the gold-plated connectors in transit.My only debate would be whether to spend the additional $2 for an Ethernet-ready cable, instead of the other AmazonBasics cable.  Unless you have a current need, this is a personal preference.  For me, I would spend the money to avoid climbing behind my entertainment center and the potential cost of buying a replacement HDMI cable in the future.  Also, the cost of a separate Ethernet cable is more than the $2 difference.  Either way, this is a great cable at a great price.

Reviews.Title: OMG!! This product is best forever!
Reviews.Author: Chloe99
Reviews.Content: I'm NOT familiar with any electronic and machines :( So when I bought this product I doubted many ways "Could I do it or call someone to help me.."I ordered 11/10 with 2days shipping but it came to me 11/11 (One day)!!Shipping is really fast and it's really extremely easy to use!Just one plug into your laptop and anther one put TV.That is it!Works very well. Sound is great!Thank you amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Use to be good, but now VERY poor
Reviews.Author: Jeff Hall
Reviews.Content: I had bought some of the older Amazon Basics HDMI cables prior to this version with the 3D support and Ethernet built-in. The 2 I had worked fine the first time I tried them and had no trouble so far. However, this is FAR from true with this version. After ordering new cables, I replaced them on my DirecTV DVR and DVD Recorder. The cables did not work for either one and I tried them several times, even "re-booting" my equipment. A picture did come on for the DirecTV and seemed fine for a while, but then it lost the entire signal again (not satellite, HDMI). It started with a dark look to the picture, then totally went dead. So, I swapped my known working cables back in and they were just fine with no problems. Also, when it did work, the picture quality seemed softer and the colors were less detailed and not as vibrant.It would seem these newer versions are not nearly as good as the ones prior or there may be a big defective batch. If yours works, great, but I know others had the same results of me having it either totally not work from the start or going bad after use for a short time. I still have one of the old versions on my AppleTV, but had to send all the new ones back.Right now I can NOT recommend these cables to anyone until they get them corrected or a better quality. If looking for a cheaper cable I have had success with "Monoprice" or more expensive cables like Monster and such work VERY well too. Sorry, but I just don't trust these right now until they change some things for addressing the quality.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't Work for 3D
Reviews.Author: T. Danison
Reviews.Content: I bought these HDMI cable specifically for hooking up my Samsung 3D Bluray Player and my new 3D LED Samsung TV.  They worked well for everything but 3D.  I put in a Bluray 3D disc in my bluray player and it would not recognize that it had a 3D connection. It said I must use a 3D bluray player or TV to view this disc.  I tried multiple Bluray 3D movies all with the same result.I then replaced these Amazon cables with other cables I had (non Amazon) that were being used to connect my PS3 and Samsung Plasma for 3D viewing and they worked.  Obviously, something is wrong with these cables and I plan on returning them after I figure out what to replace them with.

Reviews.Title: Great cable for 1/5 of the price...
Reviews.Author: L. Chico
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box these cables worked great.  I do not see any reason why anyone should pay 5-10 times more for exactly the same quality cable.

Reviews.Title: Great high quality cable
Reviews.Author: Andrew Gray "Beezer Review"
Reviews.Content: Monster cables seem to be the rage right now, however in my opinion they are just an over priced option. Anyone looking for an HDMI cable would be foolish to not consider this cable. It's high quality and think. Yes, it takes a little bit to manuver it into the right position, but it's a minor problem and easily fixed with a few twists and turns.I was looking for an HDMI cable to hook up my Xbox 360 and am glad I found this one. It works perfectly with no problems.With Amazon's frustration free packaging it really was as simple as opening the bow, plug, plug and play. No bubble/plastic packaging to fight with and the price point is spot on to what I would have paid.Best bang for your buck in HDMI cables right now.

Reviews.Title: HIgh Quality + Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: Nathan Beauchamp "ConsumerAdvocate (nathan(at...
Reviews.Content: Amazon Basics make great cables. Right now I have four of them (all different types) in use in my home and office, and all of them perform admirably. I have a USB extension cable, a mini-usb cable, a printer cable, and this HDMI cable with Ethernet support.This cable may not look that impressive next to a heavily shielded and massively overpriced juggernaut from the likes of Monster Cables. It's a relatively thin cable, and without any overbearing claims to make your digital picture even better than another digital cable. It's a simple, no frills HDMI cable at an inexpensive price. Thankfully, when it comes to digital pictures and digital cables, price does not determine anything other than the relative wisdom of the person buying the cable--in this case you don't get what you pay for. This Amazon Basics cable will deliver just as good an image as a cable 10-20X the price.I'll keep buying Amazon Basics cables as long as they continue to be inexpensive, well made, and shipped free.

Reviews.Title: Terrific! Good Value.
Reviews.Author: P. Colin McGraw "AV, Computer & EnviroTech Nut"
Reviews.Content: I've never had an issue with AmazonBasics HDMI cables and this newer model is no exception.With other brands of "ethernet/3D/audio return" cables, I've had some weird incompatibility problems with my equipment (even though it was advertised as backward compatible with older HDMI), but this Amazon one has worked like a dream!

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Emily Wilson
Reviews.Content: Good quality cable, good length, easy to open, arrived quickly and at a terrific price! What's not to love?  Amazon, please don't stop selling these, I won't be buying HDMI cables anywhere else from now on.

Reviews.Title: Top HDMI cables
Reviews.Author: J. Neuman
Reviews.Content: These are great quality HDMI cables that are affordable.  I am not saying they are good for the price, rather they are as good as the high priced HDMI cables.  I compared to my high priced HDMI cables and there is not a visible difference; at least to these eyes.  The length at under 10 feet is perfect.  It means I can pull out the component from the A/V cabinet, set it on the floor and connect the cable, run the cable through the back of the A/V cabinet, and up to the back of the TV to finish the connection with cable left over.  Great product Amazon!AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable (9.8 Feet/3.0 Meters) [Supports 3D + Audio Return Channel]

Reviews.Title: Amazon HDMI cable
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Very good HDMI cable for the price, and being almost 10' long these are MUCH better than those 6' Dynex cables from Best Buy which cost $25.  Overall, good quality, and it does what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Okay when they work
Reviews.Author: Hairy Alaskan
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cables for our new Bluray player and cable box. The one connected to out cable box worked with no issues. The one to our Blueray player started loosing the connection a few months after purchase. It would only happen a few times but steadily became more frequent. In addition to the black screens we would also get a lot of choppiness while watching DVDs. Switching the cables seemed to help a bit but the choppiness continued.I purchased replacement HDMI cables from another online retailer after recommendations from several of my coworkers. Not only did I get stouter cables which were also longer and cheaper than the Amazon cables but we are now able to watch DVDs with absolutely no loss of picture and sound or choppiness.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 6 months, now dead
Reviews.Author: Ivan Miric
Reviews.Content: I purchased a previous version of this item, before Ethernet/3D capabilities, feeling that coming from Amazon and being cheap is a great deal.Well, it worked fine for about 6 months, maybe a bit more, but recently (about a month ago) I noticed that occasionally the TV would go black and lose signal for a few seconds during gaming or watching videos on my PS3, but always quickly came back. I thought nothing of it, but a few weeks later it started happening more frequently. Now, a few days ago, the TV went black showing the "no signal" screen and never turned back on. I wiggled on the cable thinking it might be a loose connection, and to my surprise the signal came back. But a few minutes later, it did the same thing.So then I tried hooking it up to my laptop and it wouldn't even recognize the TV output. Removed it altogether, hooked it back up, and nothing, it was officially dead.So I tried a different HDMI cable (non-Amazon branded) and have been using it without issues on both my PS3 and laptop, which discards any problems with my devices.So I'm not sure what might've caused this cable to die all of a sudden. I did frequently unplug and plug it, so maybe the contacts wore off?Apart from that, the cable itself was great. The picture was crystal clear as with any other HDMI cable. It was a bit stiff, but that didn't bother me too much.Even though it was cheap, I'm not sure I'll buy another Amazon-branded HDMI cable, as there are plenty of cheap alternatives out there.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Samsudin B. Kamis "sambog"
Reviews.Content: I normally put my money on branded cables for my TV and Audio system but after reading those good review about this cable, I decided to give it a try. I was a little concerned that the cable is branded "Amazon" and was not sure if Amazon know what is good cable but I was surprise that the quality of the cable is good. The thickness and length perfect. Both end of the cable is "gold" plated which mean has better conductivity. I have used it for DirectTV to watch HD and 3D movies and the quality is amazing. I am not sure how much better it will get for $50 - $100 cable but I am happy with this quality cable.

Reviews.Title: Hdmi cables
Reviews.Author: Steve Palmer
Reviews.Content: I have bought this one and several others from different sites. These are by far the best quality for the money. The connections are all snug as opposed to the loose fitting from other cables. I have now bought 2 more to replace the others that are not near as good a quality.

Reviews.Title: This is a very good deal
Reviews.Author: Malvin
Reviews.Content: A few weeks before i got this HDMI cord I got one from Wal-Mart for $20 and it has the same quality as this one. It is precise and clear i use them for gaming and we need the best graphics and these work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Good quality but stiff
Reviews.Author: Doodle Meriwether
Reviews.Content: Though its already been stated, let me reiterate... this cable is stiff. Good luck routing it from component to component if its anything but a straight shot. What good is a great quality cable if its as stiff as a snake with rigor mortis?  I bought two of these and I may be returning one. Only reason I'm not returning both is because one is already hooked up and I don't want to mess with it.

Reviews.Title: Good enough, but not for ARC
Reviews.Author: Waialua
Reviews.Content: The AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI is an inexpensive product that is adequate in most situations, but unfortunately not all.  I have encountered issues with Audio Return Channel (ARC) using these cables to connect my LG HDTV with my LG Home Theater System.  The Audio Return Channel would not work as intended when using AmazonBasics (tried several cables of this brand and model), but worked perfectly with the slightly more expensive Mediabridge Ultra HDMI cables that I later got as replacement.  Use AmazonBasics to connect your game console or your DVD player to your TV, but get Mediabridge Ultra if you want to use Audio Return Channel (ARC), Ethernet, and 3D.

Reviews.Title: Bad copy, older design
Reviews.Author: Omar Siddique
Reviews.Content: I got a defective copy of this cable: going from laptop to TV, HD video stuttered horribly (correlated to the cable and reproducible)Besides the defective copy, this braided design is bulky and and not the newest standard.  Get the newer version of this cable instead, which is also a slimmer design.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work anymore!
Reviews.Author: Ramgorur
Reviews.Content: It's dead within a couple of months. For a while I thought my Xbox's HDMI output is not working, but changing cables fixed it. So it's the cable that isn't working. There has been no rough usage, sharp pulls, or stress on the connectors. It just stopped working. On connecting it to the Windows 7 laptop the OS does send out s 'ping' saying an HDMI cable has been connected, but no video gets send over to the projector. With every other device in place, as it is, changing the cable fixes the issue. So this cable is not working any more. I wouldn't recommend buying this.

Reviews.Title: Choppy connection
Reviews.Author: jennifer mahan
Reviews.Content: Only works well for a minute or two...then gets all streaky. Spend a smidge more and get a better cable.

Reviews.Title: Never worked.
Reviews.Author: Renee J. Swift
Reviews.Content: I have bought cheap or off brand HDMI cables before with no issues but this one never worked when I tried to connect my laptop to my sharp aquous TV. I kept getting the no signal error. I thought I was doing something wrong so after several tries/fixes I tried to connect my Western Digital media drive with the same "no signal results." I ran the gamut of options and as a last ditch effort tried the cable that generic/basic HDMI cable that came with the cable box and both devices connected to the TV perfectly.I would never buy this cord again nor would I buy an amazon brand electronic again either.

Reviews.Title: Quality!!
Reviews.Author: PanchoZapata "Peace"
Reviews.Content: I use this cable to connect my tv to my PS3, and it does make a big difference.  The picture is clear and i think the sound is better too.  I am happy I didnt spend like $80 on a monster hdmi cable.

Reviews.Title: High quality, low cost.
Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: This is replacing a Sony Official PS3 HDMI cable that cost me $50. Can't tell a difference in picture or sound quality, but I can tell a difference in the thickness of my wallet. As a bonus, this one carries Ethernet... not really useful to me as I don't own any devices that can utilize this yet, but it is nice to be future-ready. Next time I might go for the braided cable because the standard PVC is a little stiff, though that may not be a bad thing in terms of durability.

Reviews.Title: Does the Job!
Reviews.Author: FortHoodSavers
Reviews.Content: We needed an HDMI cable to be able to connect our laptop to our TV, but didn't want to spend a lot of money.  I don't have an expensive cable to compare it to, but based on my experience I see no reason to spend $30 on a cable when you can get it for less.  I was confused by all of the different types of cables when I first started looking and decided on this one after reading several reviews.  I wante dto spend as little as possible and figured I'd start with the cheapest and could always return it, but there was no need as it works fine for us.  There is the occasional flicker, but nothing that would make me go out and pay more.  That could also be due to the computer and not the cable at all.  It is a nice length and durable.  I was impressed by the quality for the price and if we need another cable I would buy this one again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDMI 1.4 Cable at a GREAT Price
Reviews.Author: Tarun Chachra "Tarun Chachra"
Reviews.Content: HDMI 1.4 is the new specification for connectivity between multiple devices.  It is based on the HEC spec which stands for the the HDMI Ethernet Channel.  The objective is quite simple...you run a single Ethernet cable to your television which essentially becomes your Ethernet switch.  You then connect all of your internet/network capable devices (dvd players, game consoles, streaming devices, etc) to your TV via HDMI 1.4 and voila - all of them get internet access.Currently you would have to use wi-fi and or run separate Ethernet cables to all of your devices...this scenario eliminates that need.  I am going to upload 2 images - a before and after scenario that will clarify the 1.4 spec.This cable is perfectly backward compatible with existing HDMI devices and thus I would HIGHLY recommend that you purchase this for future upgrade purposes.Excellent cable, excellent quality, and superb pricing.

Reviews.Title: Get all video, audio and networking on one HDMI cable
Reviews.Author: Sidarta Tanu
Reviews.Content: This AmazonBasics Braided High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet will let you connect your HD digital devices (at high ressolution up to 1080p, and including 3D TV functionality). This cable will also let you share Internet connection with other HDMI devices without a separate ethernet cable.The braided design and shielding supposed to help reduce outside signal interference and help maintain the purity of the digital signal. Make sure Amazon send you the braided version when you order this. Also check the basic non braided version for lower price.If you are trying to use the HDMI on tight corners (or backed up to the wall), you might want to buy the HDMI cable which have pivot-head/swivel design instead of bending the  head of this cable.The packaging (with Amazon 'Frustration Free' Packaging) isn't as nice looking as many other HDMI cables but I actually like it a lot since it is so easy to open compared to the hard plastic clamshell casings that most product have which is often very hard to open (where you definitely need a scissors or box cutter to open). And especially for those of you who aren't very careful and probably have hurt yourself before (as the hard plastic are sharp once you cut them) when trying to open one of those hard plastic casing.Sidarta Tanu

Reviews.Title: high quality at a great price
Reviews.Author: Kat Hooper "Kat at FanLit"
Reviews.Content: This is a super sturdy high-quality cable at a much lower cost than similar cables. The only issue is that it's so heavy and sturdy that it's not as flexible as you might need in a tight fit.I'll definitely be purchasing AmazonBasic cables in the future!

Reviews.Title: Another excellent quality and value product from AmazonBasics; set for the future
Reviews.Author: austin_Larry
Reviews.Content: Previous to receiving this, I had been using the version without Ethernet with excellent results. This has provided equally pleasing sound and picture quality. It also has the same great attributes of my previous cable; secure connections at each end, easy packaging, good value, high bandwidth. This product also is a good choice for what you need now in terms of a high quality HDMI to HDMI cable and of getting you ready for the future. It has a high bandwidth, is 3D TV ready, and, of course, also serves as an Ethernet which will continue to grow in importance as Google TV like products take hold.One thing to note though is because it also works as an Ethernet cable it is a pretty substantial and heavy cable. If you do not need the Ethernet aspect I highly recommend other products in the AmazonBasics line.

Reviews.Title: Good quality, but very inflexible.
Reviews.Author: R. Larsen
Reviews.Content: The cable works fine, looks cool.  My only gripe is that the cable is very inflexible.  I have it connected to my Roku, and it is strong enough to basically hold the device up in the air, I have to bend the cable deliberately in order to have the Roku sit flat.  It's certainly not a deal-breaker, but just something I noticed that I wanted future buyers to be aware of.An alternative may be Apple's HDMI cable that is much more pliable.

Reviews.Title: Great value but with one caveat
Reviews.Author: ImageMD
Reviews.Content: About a year ago I purchased a blue ray DVD player from a local electronics store and an HDMI cable from Amazon. My setup uses one HDMI cable to connect the DVD player to the TV and a second HDMI cable to connect my cable box to the TV. Everything worked well for about six months. But in recent months playing blue ray DVD's on my TV became a challenge.  When I turned on the DVD player, the TV did not recognize it was connected to the player. I wiggled the connectors and tried different input settings on the TV. After about 20 minutes something usually worked. I looked on-line for solutions and most comments suggested a bad connector in the DVD player. Finally I tried switching the HDMI cables, using the HDMI cable that connects the cable box to the TV for the DVD player.This solved the problem and I realized that the real culprit was the HDMI cable. I purchased a new HDMI cable from Amazon and now the DVD to TV connection works fine. I might add that the broken cable was also from Amazon basics. So, either the first cable was damaged by me or the manufacture lacks adequate quality controls. Anyway I'm now watching and listening to DVD's and CD's without problems and I like my new AmazonBasics HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: Thank you Amazon!
Reviews.Author: J. Baker
Reviews.Content: Go to Best Buy, tell them you need their "most affordable" HDMI cable, and see what they give you.I laughed, walked away, and bought mine from Amazon.The Amazon price is 1/3 of what you will pay at BB, or most any other retailer.The Amazon product though is of virtually equal performance, reliability, and durability.I am happy to see someone not rip us off by overcharging for cabling, etc. That is one of the oldest rackets in the business.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: S. Locke
Reviews.Content: We bought these cables for our big screen TV..We had read not to spend big bucks for the higher priced cables when the cheaper cables do just as good and for a lower price..Turns out, they were right! No need for the higher priced cables. These work great for us! I would highly recommend these for anyone who might need them for their TV's or Blue Ray devices!!

Reviews.Title: New to Amazon Basics Cables - Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: R. Garrelts
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years I've purchased a fair share of HDMI cables. I have everything from Monster Cable, RocketFish (Best Buy brand), Sony, and more recently Mono Price cables. Looking back on my purchases it's funny to see how my buying habits for cables evolved over the years. Like many other folks I used to buy into Monster Cables favorite adage - "your system is only as good as its weakest link". That of course being the cables and if you're buying from Monster, very pricey cables. These days I'm not drinking the kool-aid anymore and realized that even inexpensive HDMI cables can perform just as well as the expensive gear.That said the Amazon Basics HDMI cable feels anything but cheap. This sucker is a sturdy, thick, braided HDMI cable which is perfect for running inside of walls. I have my Amazon HDMI cable running in my wall from my Panasonic TC65S2 to my AV stack located in a corner closet. This is something that I wouldn't feel comfortable doing with my Sony HDMI cables which are very thin and feature only basic shielding.I can't say I've noticed any type of dramatic picture improvement to picture quality - it's a digital signal after all. But given the construction quality of these cables and the low-end price, Amazon Basics HDMI are worth purchasing. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Budget doesn't always mean bust!
Reviews.Author: RoyBoy
Reviews.Content: The first HDMI cable I bought was 4 x what I paid for this and there is no difference whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Not for XBox One.
Reviews.Author: Shibby Romes
Reviews.Content: "Worked" for about a month. I got this with my Xbox One order. It was used for the connection between my DVR and the Xbox. I noticed constant freezing of my Tv video signal and troubleshooted everything. I finally replaced the cable and the problem vanished. Rating 3 stars because I'm not sure if it was a dud or if the cable is just not up to par for my needs. Still a great price, if it works for another purpose.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Basics High Speed HDMI 6.5' cables.
Reviews.Author: Steve Douglas
Reviews.Content: I have been using these cables for about a month now.  I purchased them just prior to buying the new Panasonic ZT 65"  plasma TV and a new Oppo 103 Blu Ray player.  I was almost on the verge of purchasing a few of those $300. each HDMI cables when I was assured that even with as high end of a system as mine is, that I would not be able to hear or see a difference.  I needed four cables and so ordered.  They were right,  the audio and video that passes  through these far less expensive cables will do the job for you in an exemplary manner.  I have no complaints or concerns about them at all.  They are very well built and do not feel at all flimsy or poorly constructed.Glad I was able to save myself a thousand dollars.I can honestly encourage you to make this money saving purchase, I really don't think you will regret it.Hope this very short review has been of some help to you.

Reviews.Title: A very effective product but very stiff and very heavy in construction
Reviews.Author: Rob Slaven "slavenrm@gmail. com"
Reviews.Content: I bought this cable with the intent of running it behind some furniture to connect my flat screen television to my laptop computer.  As a simply practical matter, the cable has served wonderfully.  The connectors are sturdy and well constructed and the picture quality is immaculate.  I've never had any problem with the operation of the cable.The only negative I would propose is that the cable is VERY stiff and very heavy.  In my usage of it, it runs behind furniture and doesn't move about but if you would need this cable to be mobile in any way then it's not an optimal choice.  This cable could survive a nuclear holocaust but it's far from nimble.  For the price though, I can't really even begin to complain

Reviews.Title: Quality cannot be beat
Reviews.Author: Joel O. Joseph
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 25ft version of this cable for a slideshow presentation that I was hosting at a wedding. At 10mm in diameter it is much thicker and well shielded than what I was expecting for this price. I used it to connect my alienware m18x laptop to an Epson PowerLite 1761W Projector. Audio and video quality at 1080p was above and beyond my expectations. At this price purchasing this cable to a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: 25' HDMI Cable-Amazon Basics
Reviews.Author: R. Fuqua
Reviews.Content: This cable was purchased to connect a PS3 to a 3D/2D projector for an outdoor movie night.  It worked perfectly.  Why you would pay anymore money for a 'monster' of a cable is beyond me.  I will definitely recommend purchasing this cable over others due to the cost.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, Works great, Awesome Quality
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I think I am only buying AmazonBasics HDMI cables in the future. They are substantially lower priced than their retail store equivalents. And I would venture to say these are better quality than "monster cables", especially considering cost. Using this with an Epson Projector. works perfectly!

Reviews.Title: Don't let the stores tell you that you need an expensive one!
Reviews.Author: Derek A. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: An HDMI cable is an HDMI cable - don't let Best Buy or others try and up sell you a $60-100 one.  These work perfectly, are cheap, and save you tons of money.  Whenever I have gotten a new tv or some other piece of AV equipment, they always try to tell me I need a "blu-ray HDMI cable" or a "3-D ready HDMI cable" and when I tell them that a cheap HDMI cable is the same as one of theirs they claim they are not.  I have these on my 3-D tv, my PS3, and my blu-ray players.Cheap, reliable, and excellent quality!

Reviews.Title: High Quality, High Performance
Reviews.Author: Lucy Cat "Mandy"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, heavy-duty HDMI cable with solid, high quality connectors. This works great with my XBOX 360, my MacBook Air (in tandem with a third party miniport to HDMI adapter) and my iPad (with the official Apple HDMI adapter).  I have tested it on a variety of LG flat panel TVs, some older and cheaper LCDs and with an overhead projector.  Works great all around.  Only negative might be that its a bit heavy/bulky for travel.  Otherwise, Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: A cable is a cable. This one works for me.
Reviews.Author: Joseph Siegler
Reviews.Content: There is not a lot to say about this cable. They either work or they don't, and this one works.I could get into a long dissertation about the differences between expensive cables and cheap cables, but I'm definitely in the camp that the cheaper ones work just as well. Perhaps not the cheapest ones, but that's not what these are - these are not one cent cables.I am using this as a standard HDMI cable from my TiVo to my HDTV. To that, I can't properly test the newer features like audio return and 3-D. But as a standard HDMI cable it works quite well and it's good value. So the additional features are irrelevant to me in this case.

Reviews.Title: The Best for Less
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Just got a Samsung 3D HDTV that came bundled with a Samsung Blu-Ray player and needed the appropriate cables to go with it.  Given that the TV has two HDMI ports I bought two of these cables because they support the high-speed standard that is required for 3D.  Long story short, these cables are top of the line and I can not see any difference between these and the ones that cost $30 more per cable at major retailers such as Best Buy or Walmart.  Combined with the Prime Shipping because they are an Amazon product I saved well over $60 by ordering 2 of these and not driving to a local store.  The cables are easy to manage and are more than long enough for my wall mount that I bought to go with the TV. They also came nicely packaged and did not require 10 minutes of prying open a plastic package with a sharp knife and risk cutting the cables.  Excellent product, excellent price, no surprises...I love how Amazon does things!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Quality At A Great Price.
Reviews.Author: J. Figueroa
Reviews.Content: I bought a few of these cables to use with my new home theater set-up. A Samsung LED 3D TV, Denon receiver, Xbox 360, PS3 and cable box. This cable is capable of handling high defenition and 3D signals with perfection.I tested bluray and DVDs, 3D, gaming and cable signals. All without issues.The cable is well made, strong and flexible. Gold plated connectors with sturdy housings. I've had them for a few months now and have no complaints.I always buy Amazon basics cables. From optical to micro USB and now HDMI, they always exceed my expectations and I will keep coming back for more. Amazon shows that a great quality cable doesn't have to cost a fortune.Do yourself a favor and save yourself some money, this is an outstanding quality cable, backed by an oustanding company. Thumbs up Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I bought this cable to connect my new laptop to my television and it works great. The cord is very durable and reliable and the setup process is fairly straight forward. The connection has always met expectations, but my only regret is not buying a slightly longer cord as at times the length has limited my flexibility of usage with a laptop. So essentially, great quality cord, but consider length when buying.

Reviews.Title: Fail after 6 month use!!!
Reviews.Author: S.Wave "Sound"
Reviews.Content: Pro: cheap for it price and you get what you pay for! works no different than standard HDMI cable.Con:: Fail after my 6th month use, I use to for with my projector connected with my computer so the end of cable will have to bend close to 75 degree against the wall. After 6 month the cable will not work once I unplug it and try it again on a different degree angle. This cheaply made cable is not for your tight walls nor it lasts long. Pay little more and get a real quality one.

Reviews.Title: Does not work for my Xbox, but does work on my Roku *UPDATE - replacement works!*
Reviews.Author: ETC
Reviews.Content: Bought this cable for my Xbox - hooked it up and no signal, so I wondered if I had a faulty cable. Swapped cables with the HDMI cable for my Roku to test - Xbox worked and Roku worked. Swapped back, Xbox no longer worked. No idea why this cable doesn't work for the Xbox.UPDATE 12/6 - I received my replacement cable from Amazon today and it works just fine with my Xbox. I must've gotten a wonky cable the first time around. Thanks for the quick shipping on my replacement, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: With data cables: they either work or they don't. This one works...
Reviews.Author: 35-year Technology Consumer "8-tracks to 802.11"
Reviews.Content: Lots of options in the HDMI cable market, and plenty of opportunities to overspend. Many manufacturers are happy to sell you HDMI cables with "monsterous" mark-ups.Don't fall for for it.You can easily find similar cables costing 10 or 20 times what this one sells for. And you'd never ever be able to tell the difference in the video or audio quality.Don't fall for it.This cable provided clear HD video and pristine audio output for digital data flowing between a Sony Blu-ray Player and a Sony LED HDTV .For less than 10 bucks, why pay more?

Reviews.Title: Cheap and works fine for 3D
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I bought these for a new LG 3DTV I was helping my parents get. The cables have worked fine. There are no display issues occurring while watching a 3D bluray movie (via this cable and a bluray player).Cheap and good for 3D. The next challenge comes today when a new audio receiver comes and we need to route HDMI through that. I'll update my review if possible at that time, but I am very pleased with these cables.

Reviews.Title: Cheap HDMI...enough said
Reviews.Author: S. Carlson
Reviews.Content: I think by this point in 2011 we all know what an HDMI cable is and what it's for, so I won't bore you with tech info. This was a hookup solution for my new Roku box, and it fit the bill perfectly with a fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Monolith50
Reviews.Content: I have a 50" plasma TV w/ 3D capability. I'm also an avid PS3 gamer so this cable is used constantly.I've been using these cables for over a year now and have had no problems.I highly recommend this cable.(At a local retail store they'll try and get you to buy one for $50.00 that does the same thing)

Reviews.Title: Capable cables
Reviews.Author: Berbot
Reviews.Content: The cables arrived as indicated in a recyclable, easy to open cardboard box.  6.5 foot length is perfect for my fairly complicated A/V system... just enough to reach without the excess cable to clutter the already tight space.Second time I have ordered these cables in addition to some toslink versions of the cable and will order more in the future, if needed.

Reviews.Title: Don't Get Ripped off Buying Cables at Retail Stores
Reviews.Author: Gerald Schoenburg
Reviews.Content: At under 8.00, these cables offered by Amazon  will work exactly like the Monster 100.00 cable.  I'm not sure where people are saying that 1.4 is needed for 3d.  The 1.3 cables at 10.2 GBPS work as well as the 1.4 at 15.2 GBPS.  There is no commercial media I know of that requires 15.2 at this time.However, if you need HDMI cables, just buy these at this low price and you will get everything you need.  If you want to see an excellent primer, go to mycablemart.com.  Their cables are very high quality and "pretty".  Their prices are good but they nail you on shipping.  They are an Amazon associated company.The Amazon new optical cables are also very good.  If you can't use your HDMI for sound, this is a good second best way to hear great sound.  Spend 25.00 bucks and get free shipping.Jerry

Reviews.Title: High quality cables without the wallet reaching price
Reviews.Author: defcon4
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled into buying expensive HDMI cables. The whole point of switching to digital connections was to eliminate any potential for signal degredation that could be experienced with the "old" analog connectors. If the hdmi cable meets the hdmi specs (search hdmi 1.3 and 1.4 standards) and an image is displayed when they connect, then you're getting the highest quality signal possible. Don't be fooled by the marketing schemes of expensive cable manufacturers.All that being said, these are well built cables, and I'm very impressed with their build quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: HDMI High-Def Cable
Reviews.Author: A J
Reviews.Content: No need to overthink this.  Amazon's basic cable works great and is delivered quickly.  Forget the overpriced brand names.  So easy to use and it even looks good.

Reviews.Title: Fixed my Apple TV problem
Reviews.Author: Rick Wride
Reviews.Content: My Apple TV wasn't working with my new LCD flatscreen.  This high speed HDMI cable fixed the problem: Apple TV plays Netflix and iTunes movies perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Quality cable at a great price
Reviews.Author: barry
Reviews.Content: HDMI cables used to be a tricky thing for me.  How do you find the best one that would perform the best?  Price really isn't a factor.  You could buy an inexpensive one and get one of poor quality and even buy a higher priced one and still get the same poor quality.  The answer of course rested in finding the brand you could trust.  My blu ray player was working sporadically.  Everything in my home theater system is set up with HDMI cables but they can get loose, wobbly and thus provide a broken up signal.  I was thrilled to see Amazon now has their own brand AmazonBasics.  I really trust Amazon, especially due to how much they stand behind their products.  I purchased this HDMI ethernet cable and replaced my blu ray one with it.  Now my blu ray player works perfectly.Amazon provides full description and detail of what this HDMI cable will provide.  I can tell you it is of very high quality and works better than those double the price.  I have purchased many more for friends who have wobbly, often ineffective HDMI cables and all are now relying on this HDMI cable as well as me for all their home theater hook up needs.  When you find the brand that works you know to stick with it and I have found that with AmazonBasics.  And the price is amazing.  A great product at a superb price.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: VS2929
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing! I thought oh this might not be a good cable at first but boy was i wrong. This cable gives what a monster $100 cable would do just cheaper. The quality of the build doesn't feel cheap either its as durable as a normal expensive cable, I would highly recommend this cable to anyone who wants the same HDMI quality and picture as a 50-60-70 dollar cable go with this one it will be a big value but great purchase.***Update 3/1/12***: This cable still performs like new and I have had no trouble since! I am very happy with my purchase and i saved about 50 bucks by going with this cable. This product still receives an A+ Rating.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, Amazing Price!!
Reviews.Author: mczimmz
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful HMDI. Definately worth buying. A friend let me borrow his $40 HDMI cord that was best quailty while i waited for this one to come in the mail. When I plugged it into mp PS3, I got the same picture and sound quality as the other Cord. The length of the cable can come in very handy too. Why would you spend money on a $40+ HDMI cable when you can get the same quailty for this low price. Definately a smart buy.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Sergio Amaya
Reviews.Content: Welcome and thank you amazon customer for reading this review, well, what can I tell you about this product? One word will describe it, AWESOME! I strongly suggest you that if you need a HDMI cable, this is the prefect option for you guys. It works perfectly, my games and movies looks awesome on my TV with this cable. So cheer up and buy it, trust me you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm
Reviews.Author: Mickey
Reviews.Content: I bought this to run between my Sony Blu-Ray player and my Vizio 1080p flatscreen.  It works great and I couldn't ask for more. I'm not sure how it works in gaming applications but I'd imagine it would be just fine. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Great cables
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: Love Amazon Basic cables, and cannot recommend them high enough. They are well made and fit well, perfect for the job. I only buy Amazon Basic cables.If you think you need to spend big money to get good HDMI cables you are WRONG. Basically HDMI cables transmit 1's and 0's, and you cannot improve them over a cable - so why pay more. Some manufacturers make up all sorts of rubbish to allow them to charge stupid prices for cables. It would be like buying a garden hose because the manufacturer said the water will be better quality when it comes out the other end (but some people still do).

Reviews.Title: Great buy, works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Trev
Reviews.Content: Great buy. Lots of people think the quality of the cable is important for HDMI but that's absolutely untrue. Unlike analog cables, digital cables either work or they don't, there's no signal degradation on "cheaper" cables. It's insane that people spend $60 on a name brand HDMI cable when a $10 one is just as good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDMI Cable for the Price
Reviews.Author: Tetsu Uma "The 'Iron Horse'"
Reviews.Content: The AmazonBasics High Speed HDMI Cable has many nice features at a great price.  The terminals are gold plated which prevents oxidation and supports excellent electrical conductivity, the cable is very flexible so I can easily thread it through multimedia cabinets (without worrying about kinking), and at 2m (6'6") it is long enough to reach wall mounted TVs or video components without being taut.  The performance is excellent and I can see no difference between this and another higher priced cable I own.  Looking at cables at even the big box discount stores, I couldn't find one available at even twice the price of the AmazonBasics cable.  I haven't yet been able to test the ethernet function but I like to think that I am ahead of the curve and won't have to replace cables when I upgrade my video components.I think the AmazonBasics High Speed HDMI Cable is an excellent value in video cables and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: WOW BEST HDMI EVER!
Reviews.Author: californian otaku "american otaku"
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical at first, but i gotta say, WOW i noticed a huge increase in video quality. i got this for my ps3, which had trouble outputing 1080p with deep-color enabled. however, the previous HDMI was a 1.2a version. this newest 1.4 version is waaaaaaaaaaaay better. now my ps3 can output 1080p WITH deep-color enabled, and not only do is see richer colors, but overal quality and sharpnes has increased too! simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: You will get ripped off if you buy anything else more expensive
Reviews.Author: Ronald Epstein "Ronald Epstein"
Reviews.Content: I now what you are thinking right now.  $7.99 for HDMI cables that I find in the stores for 2-3 the price?  What kind of quality product is Amazon pushing on us?Yeah, I felt that way.  After all, I have been a Home Theater enthusiast for over 30 years and I have learned that you should be careful about buying connection wire at prices that seem too good to be true.  After all, you want to buy product that is not only going to provide superior quality but last you for many years.I am brainwashed just like many of you into thinking that good HDMI cable should cost much more than this.  And Amazon cable?  What do they know about producing HDMI cable?So, I bought my first set of these cables two months ago for friends.  I figured that the reviews here were good enough that I could use them as guinea pigs and see for myself how good these Amazon cables really are.I was very surprised to see that each cable arrived in its own cardboard box, neatly tied and with caps on the end of each plug.  Very, very impressive.  Hooking the cables up between display and Blu-ray player it seemed to work as it should.In fact, I was so impressed with the quality of the cables and the care that Amazon put into shipping them (most of the time they send them overnight to Prime members),  the next day I decided to upgrade 3 of the HDMI cables connected to my various components.  Once again, they all arrived in neat little cardboard boxes, tied and capped.These are quality cables, make no mistake about them.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!

I bought this cable because I was disappointed on how much I spent on a cable before, but this cable has great quality. The image is perfect and the speed is fast enough for gaming. I can't review the internet capabilities, but I got this one just in case I decide to upgrade my TV.Update: After extensive use, I can say this cables are great quality. I even tried 3D picture and it looks great, still waiting to test the internet functionality.

As some of you know all HDMI cables broadcast in the same tone so those 100 dollar cables are a scam. If you need a cable either it be to connect something or for gaming the signal is perfect and clear,Great picture and all around great package. A must have Basic essential.--thanks

Reviews.Content: It is a very great price($7.99) for the cable. works great so far with  my LG blue-ray dvd player hooked up to Vizio 55 LED TV that also purchased on amazon.com 2. I don't have 3 D ,so really cant tell you about this part. Don't buy  the expensive one at walmart or bestbuy .This one is as good as others.

The cable seems constructed well and works great so far with my LG blu-ray player hooked up to my 32" Vizio LCD 720p TV.Wish I could test the ethernet capabilities and the 3D but I'm glad it as that feature just in case I need it in the future.

Reviews.Title: Very high quality and tight fit
Reviews.Author: :::DIGITAL BABE::: ":::DIGITAL BABE:::"
Reviews.Content: We recently added a "Roku XD" to our home theater, and I've connected it using this Amazon cable. First off, we've owned Monster Cables, cables from companies tha specialize in OEM manufacture of high quality cables, and now these. The manufacturing quality of these cables is truly stellar. It is the first thing I noticed when feeling it out of the package. We have a number of Blu-Ray, HD DVD players, and an HDMI switch, etc, as part of several home theaters in the home. The cable fits tight (important for connective and signal purposes), into the Roku and into the TV. The cable is strong and the connectors are of excellent quality. This is one of several of the "Amazon Basics" products I've tried and the quality is superb. Very happy with this addition to our home theater, and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with my smart TV
Reviews.Author: kb
Reviews.Content: I went ahead and bought this HDMI cable after seeing the reviews. This doesn't work with my smart 3D TV .

Reviews.Author: John Wall "Marketing Over Coffee"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the plain version of this cable and then used it to hook up a family member's DVD player and replaced it with the braided version so I could see what the difference was.Braided:More expensiveStiffer, can be a problem if you have to make a tight corner within 3 inches of the end of the cableI'd think it's more durable, it seems much tougherIt has that Monster Cable heft feel if that means anything to youPlain:CheaperLighterMore flexibleDoes not feel like Monster CableHaving used both, I like the plain because I travel with mine so lighter and more flexible are big plusses. Cheaper is an added bonus.I've noticed no difference in performance, both have worked perfectly for me.

Reviews.Title: Amazon HDMI High Speed Cable
Reviews.Author: Shorian "gadget guru"
Reviews.Content: My cable company has provided me with cheap HDMI cables. I have experienced flickering, and loss of signal amoung other problems. The High Speed cables from Amazon have performed flawlessly so far. There is not much more to say about the cable except it works well. I am not an engineer or technician so I can't speak to the quality of the materials. Performance tells me they are decent quality.

Reviews.Title: No Reason to Pay Extra
Reviews.Author: Gumby2718
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just bought a Samsung Plasma TV.  When my wife came back from the electronics store she had two $120 cables (HDMI) and a $30 fiber cable.  I was dumbfounded.  She went on to explain that the salesman said these are the `best' cables and they come with some kind of upgrade guarantee.So I went back to Amazon and found two other cables to buy - these and the AmazonBasics High Speed HDMI Cable (9.8 Feet / 3.0 Meters) - Supports Ethernet, 3D and Audio Return (Newest Standard).  We spent an evening swapping the $120 cable, these cables, and the $11.99 cable on our blu-ray player and simply found no difference.Further, I found a great article on cnet that summed it up like this:  There's no reason to pay extra for HDMI cables ([...]).I simply can't justify spening $120 or $50 for a cable when the $11.99 cable does what I need it to do.  Please know that we even tried the 3D features and they worked just fine - Shrek never looked so good!

Reviews.Title: HDMI 1.4 Quality
Reviews.Author: Dr. Stuart Gitlow
Reviews.Content: Understanding the differences among HDMI cables requires some understanding of the basic HDMI specifications. The specs have changed over the past few years and we're now up to Version 1.4. This new version includes some important changes to the 1.3 specification:* A new 100Mb/s HDMI Ethernet Channel* An increased resolution capability3D formats and resolutions up to 1080p are therefore supported. Note that Deep Color capabilities were already present in HDMI 1.3.The cable for HDMI 1.4 will fit into the HDMI slot on older equipment. That is, if you are using an older TV, processor, Bluray player, or other device that does not utilize the 1.4 specification, you can still use this newer cable. If you have a brand new 1.4-capable device and use a 1.3 cable, you may or may not get the high resolution and you won't get the Ethernet capabilities. That latter issue is only in the 1.4-spec cables.Digital is quite different from analog. With digital signals, you either have the signal or you don't. As you know from digital TV over-the-air, the picture is either perfect or it's missing entirely. There's no in between as there was in the old analog transmission days. With that in mind, there is almost no difference between a high-end expensive digital cable and an inexpensive but well-constructed digital cable. Either the picture and sound will be flawless or it will be missing. There's no need to spend a lot of money.So here we have a high quality HDMI cable that meets the new specifications for HDMI 1.4 that will be of interest to most folks. It has the high speed capability (this will allow 1080p, and note that SOME HDMI 1.4 cables are not high speed) AND it has the Ethernet connectivity.Using an Oppo BDP-93 Blu-ray player and a Sony 3D monitor, bypassing my processor which is not 1.4 capable, I found this cable to work without any difficulties, providing the connectivity as desired. The cable itself is not so stiff as to be difficult to maneuver and 10 feet is sufficient to allow the cable to easily reach your home theater gear if your setup is nearby to the TV. I noted that the cable is promoted as being "braided" but the exterior of the cable I received has a solid coating...no big deal, of course, since I never see the cable once it's in place.So ... the right cable for the right price for all your newest 3D and Blu-ray equipment.

Reviews.Title: fantastic bargain for a high quality basic cable
Reviews.Author: Rudolf Schmid "nmnori"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic price for a quality cable, whether used for just HDMI linkage or also for the other options (Ethernet, 3D, Audio Return). You can pay lots more money for cables from name brands, but knowledgeable expects have repeatedly concluded that the touted benefits of such expensive cable alternatives are entirely illusionary. And this inexpensive cable is backed by Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: Donna Capshaw "Grandma"
Reviews.Content: Works just like it should, I plugged it in and was able to use it immediately. It is just the right length and it is easy to identify the connectors. It is a good quality product.

Reviews.Title: Easy and lightweight HDMI cable does it all.
Reviews.Author: Sadie
Reviews.Content: I connected my Blu Ray disc player to my HDTV with this HDMI cable.  The picture is clear and the sound quality is excellent.  This cable is a light weight smooth vinyl, which is easy to handle.  The 6.5' is a bit long and I can easily go down to a 4' cable for the purpose.  The shorter the cable the better the quality, but I don't notice a drop in quality when using a 10' cable, so there really isn't a difference in sound or picture quality from watching TV directly from a cable box with a 6.5' cable either.For anyone who has not used an HDMI cable and is new to HDTV, this cable can be used to hook up your cable box, DVD or Blu Ray disc player, computer, Wii, sound system and whatever else you have that has an HDMI cable connector.  You do not need to use separate audio cables as this beauty steams everything through it.  It's super simple to use - just plug it in to your HDTV and plug the other end into the other component and play.  I suggest getting HDMI cables for each separate component so you don't have to pull out the DVD cable to plug in your computer.

The results look great on my TV and I saved money over the premium brands.  I'm not a video or audiophile, but do appreciate a great picture.  This cable delivers.My one complaint isn't about the product but about the Amazon shipping.  I'm a Prime customer but it took more than 4 business days to get my cable even through it shipped within plenty of time to get here in the 2 day window.  Luckily, I wasn't really in a hurry so it wasn't a huge deal.  I'll just plan ahead next time.

Rodino, M.D.

Reviews.Author: NyReckDiver
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have come to trust Amazon Basics products.  From batteries, cell phone cases, camera gear, and HDMI cables.  I have never been let down.  These cables are perhaps the most shining example of the Amazon Basics Line.  Note, as o fthis review, the Amazon Cable meets the latest HDMI specifications.The cable arrived packaged very well and ahead of schedule (we have new distribution centers nearby).  The build quality of the cable meets or exceeds HDMI cables of equivalent length for which I have paid $20 to $30. This is noticeable the minute you open the package and feel the cable.  The HDMI connections of the Amazon Cable to my Apple TV and Televsion were an absolute perfect fit.  When inserted, it takes a distinctive pull to disconnect. Performance of the cable is no less different.  Absolute crystal clarity on HD 1080. No noise, and excellent sound. It amazes me when I look back, how much money I spent on cables.Bottom line- save yourself money and get the Amazon Basics cable. I have now outfitted all my new connections with these cables.

So, i went and bought a new cable, plugged it in, and it worked great! The problem was with the AmazonBasics cable. Others i'm sure had fantastic luck with theirs, but mine was a dud.

Just order one of these and you're set.I have been using these cables for about 4 months now and they are working just as good as the day I bought them.
